p: Sequence of Influenza A virus was downloaded from NCBI influenza virus Resource ( http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genomes/FLU/FLU.html). The sequence of strains whose host was human and all eight segments had full-length was extracted for further analysis. Computer program miRanda software 3.3a [ 32, 33] was used to scan the genomes of human Influenza A virus for the presence of target sites for the human miRNAs listed in miRbase ( http://www.mirbase.org/). The cutoff values for miRanda score and minimal free energy of binding were set to 140 and − 15 kcal/mol. An exact matching to 5′ end seed region (positions 2–8) of the mature miRNA was used and the G:U base pairing was not allowed. Other parameters of the software were kept as default. miRNA-target gene pairs were confirmed using RNAHybrid at http://bibiserv.techfak.uni-bielefeld.de/.
